'''Larry Elmore''' (born [[5 August]] [[1948]]) is an American fantasy artist, most notable in helping to define the look of ''[[Dungeons and Dragons]]'' and contributing art and comics to the related ''[[Dragon Magazine]]''.<ref name=CCGA>{{CCGA|entry=Elmore, Larry D.}}, pp. 123-124</ref> He was contracted by [[Iron Crown Enterprises]] to create artwork for the ''[[Middle-earth Collectible Card Game]]''.

==Career==
After getting a fine arts degree at Western Kentucky University, he became an early key staff artist at [[TSR]]. After leaving the company in [[1987]], as a freelancer he worked for many other games, such as ''[[Magic: The Gathering]]'' and the ''Middle-earth Collectible Card Game''.<ref name=CCGA/>
